title: Household Education - the passage can be regarded

content.question: Taken as a whole, the passage can best be regarded as

choices.label: an argument for enlarging and enriching the minds of women
an examination of the educational reforms occurring during the nineteenth century
an inquiry into why domestic duties take precedence over intellectual pursuits
a case for more equitable distribution of household chores

content.answer: an argument for enlarging and enriching the minds of women

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Identify and describe components of the rhetorical situation - the exigence, audience, purpose, context, and message.
